content.description: Stemming and jug hauling on overhanging rock.
content.location: Starts in a groove by the big boulder at the left end of the wall.

climbs.name: Ugly Crack is what I call it

content.description: Bulging overhung wide crack leads to lower angle lichen covered easier climbing.
content.protection: Pro from #5 to finger sized cams.
content.location: Right most route on the upper wall and the only groove crack.

content.description: Good route that is fairly sustained and had a cool hold at one of the cruxes. Now I stay left at the undercling to maintain the grade.
content.location: Starts up the right angling weakness that leads to the left side of the big roof band.

content.description: Getting the 2nd clip takes some footwork to make it a bit less tenuous.
content.location: On the shorter left end of the wall.  Start from the boulder and step across to the pillar.

content.description: Pulls several small and fun roofs, to a great thin technical section.  The name comes from an area that you don't want to grab inside the hole, and the balancy nature of the crux.
content.location: Just right of Plateonic Love, or the third left climb from the tree.  Look for the big orange hole

content.description: Technical climbing to a great steep section and a little slab as well.
content.location: Start from a flat rock with a low bolt toward the right side of the wall.

content.description: Really amazing rock and holds down low, followed by jugs.
content.location: Between Jackie's Separation Anxiety, and Sting Ray.  A big side pull just left of the bolts helps identify this climb.

climbs.name: Plateonic Love
climbs.fa: Christian Rodenbeck, EFR,Eric Ruljancich,Mike Dudley,Chen Liang,'10

content.description: Spooky looking plates are really cool and one climbs a little like a hanging tufa. This leads to slightly spicy but safe moves to roof with a stout finish. If you are taller it is a letter grade easier.
content.location: Roughly in the middle of the face the route starts just right of big plates that you just can't resist.

content.description: Short and steep with, like all routes here, some big holds along the way and a very attractive vertical crystal dike in the middle.  Trends left after the first bulge.
content.location: Starts just left of a little a groove which is left of the boulder that Step Class starts from.  A bolt down low is a little right of the start.

content.description: It may be short but it is in your face from start to finish.
content.location: Far left end of cliff the route angles up and right.
Starts just right of groove which is the start of X-Ray.

content.description: Tricky hard bouldery start with cool layback moves. When you get to the jug to clip the third bolt it is possible to stem or move right for a big rest which you are welcome to do if you like. probably mid to hard eleven if you do.
content.location: Right of big dead tree, left of grungy groove.

content.description: The 11- start to Stingray branches right to a right angling crack then up a cool face. Originally I set this up as a climb that took two or three pieces of gear to protect it. Today 8/19/2018 I added two bolts where the gear could be placed. Seemed silly in hindsight not to have bolted it. As you can see from the comments it can be lead on gear or bolts. With the direct start you no longer need to do the original start. Not sure why we didn't set it up this way to begin with.
content.location: Same start as Stingray.  At fourth bolt clip the right hand of two then make an awkward move right into the crack system.

content.description: Moves to a jug at a low first bolt are powerful and lead to good holds to the right. From there work back left to the hanging corner until possible to make cool roof moves that quickly lead into the bolted upper part of Geirless Warrior
content.protection: Bolts, Steel carabiners at the anchors.
content.location: Starts right of Stingray where a big roundish jug sticks out. A seemingly too low bolt makes the first moves safe and shows you the start.

content.description: The funky rock is not what you want to use and it can be avoided by staying just right of it.  This route and Raycreation are close together at one point and they join for a moment higher up.
content.location: On the right side of wall is a low rock and the route starts just left of it with a very low bolt.

content.description: The Upper Wall is covered with big holds with the occasional thin section between them.  The wall is slightly overhanging and has a few roofs or bulges to surmount.
